column3: # Fix radial migration?

# Do turbulent diffusion if migration == True

# Put monomers at a random position?
# Use constant timestep instead of adative timestep
# Maximum fraction of turbulent timescale for adaptive timestep
# Maximum fraction of collision timescale for adaptive timestep
# Maximum fraction of drift timescale for adaptive timestep
# Maximum fraction of ice mass change timescale for adaptive timestep
# Constant timestep size (in yr) to use. Note 0.1 yr is too long if r<1 AU.
# Lower bound in timestep size (in yr) when using adaptive timesteps.
# Use same seed for stochastic events. Leads to deterministic monomer behavior
# Seed to use if determinstic==True
# Print function statistics (running time) at the end of the simulation
# Set true if you want to benchmark with Piso+ 2015
# set true if we want to do the settling test from Krijt & Ciesla 2016
# Initial radial position (in AU)
# Initial vertical position (in AU)
# Integration time (in kyr)
# Inner radial sampling distance (in AU) if we pick randomly initial monomer position.
# Inner cutoff radius within which we terminate the integration (in AU)
# Monomer size (in m)
# Initial monomer depth (in m)
# Monomer material density (Woitke+ 2016)
# Adsorption/desorption site density on monolayer (Hollenbach+ 2009; Piso+ 2015)
# Number of actively desorbing ice monolayers (Cuppen+ 2017)
# Photodesorption yield rate (Oberg 2009)
# Home aggregate filling factor
# Collision mass ratio where we start using grouping formalism of (Ormel & Spaans 2008; Krijt & Ciesla 2016).
# Collision mass ratio where fragmentation and erosion transition (Krijt & Ciesla 2016)
# Fragmentation velocity (Krijt & Ciesla 2016. 1 m/s might be better (Guttler et al. 2010; Birnstiel et al. 2010)
# Power law slope of fragmentation products (Birnstiel+ 2010)
# Molecular cross section used in the calculation of mfp (Okuzumi+ 2012; Krijt+ 2018)
# Reference number of number of adsorption sites (e.g. Piso+ 2015)
